name: TVS Apache RTR 160 4V Fi
short_description: TVS Apache RTR 160 4V Fi - A fuel-injected 159.7cc sporty street motorcycle with aggressive styling and race-inspired features. Offers precise throttle response and efficient performance.

image_urls.alt: TVS Apache RTR 160 4V Fi Front View
TVS Apache RTR 160 4V Fi Side View
TVS Apache RTR 160 4V Fi Back View

pros: Fuel-injected engine for precise throttle response
Good ground clearance for various road conditions
Sporty exhaust note enhances riding experience
cons: Base variant comes with rear drum brake
Noticeable vibrations at higher RPM ranges
Relatively small fuel tank limits touring capability
Firm seat may cause discomfort on long rides
No dual-channel ABS in this variant

faqs.question: Does this model come with ABS?
faqs.answer: The base Fi variant comes without ABS, but single-channel ABS is available as an option.

faqs.question: What's the acceleration performance like?
faqs.answer: It can accelerate from 0-60 kmph in 4.2 seconds and 0-100 kmph in 11.5 seconds.

faqs.question: Is this suitable for daily city commuting?
faqs.answer: Yes, its lightweight design and good low-end torque make it very suitable for city riding.

faqs.question: How does the fuel injection system benefit the rider?
faqs.answer: Fuel injection ensures better throttle response, improved fuel efficiency, and smoother performance across RPM ranges compared to carbureted engines.

name: TVS Apache RTR 160 4V SMARTXCONNECT DD
short_description: TVS Apache RTR 160 4V SMARTXCONNECT DD - Features a digital dash with smartphone connectivity, offering a tech-enhanced riding experience with the same 159.7cc performance.

image_urls.alt: TVS Apache RTR 160 SMARTXCONNECT DD Front View
TVS Apache RTR 160 SMARTXCONNECT DD Side View
TVS Apache RTR 160 SMARTXCONNECT DD Back View

pros: SmartXonnect digital dash with smartphone connectivity
Same peppy 159.7cc engine as other variants
Good value for money with tech features
cons: Rear drum brake limits braking performance
Bluetooth connectivity can be finicky at times
Small fuel tank compared to competitors

faqs.question: What does the SmartXonnect system offer?
faqs.answer: It provides smartphone connectivity for call/SMS alerts, navigation assist, and ride analytics.

faqs.question: Is there any performance difference from the Fi variant?
faqs.answer: The engine is identical, but the added tech features make it slightly heavier, affecting acceleration marginally.

faqs.question: Does this variant have ABS?
faqs.answer: No, the SMARTXCONNECT DD variant comes without ABS.

faqs.question: Can I use navigation on the digital display?
faqs.answer: Yes, the SmartXonnect system supports turn-by-turn navigation when paired with your smartphone via Bluetooth.

name: TVS Apache RTR 160 4V SMARTXCONNECT SD
short_description: TVS Apache RTR 160 4V SMARTXCONNECT SD - Combines the 159.7cc engine with a semi-digital console and SmartXonnect features, offering a balance of tech and performance.

image_urls.alt: TVS Apache RTR 160 SMARTXCONNECT SD Front View
TVS Apache RTR 160 SMARTXCONNECT SD Side View
TVS Apache RTR 160 SMARTXCONNECT SD Back View

pros: Good balance between price and features
cons: Semi-digital console instead of full digital

faqs.question: What's the difference between DD and SD variants?
faqs.answer: The SD has a semi-digital console while DD has a full digital display, otherwise they share the same features.

faqs.question: Does this variant support navigation?
faqs.answer: Yes, through the SmartXonnect app, but it's more limited than the DD variant.

faqs.question: Is the riding position aggressive?
faqs.answer: It's moderately sporty but comfortable for daily use with slightly rear-set footpegs.

faqs.question: Does the SD variant get the same LED lighting?
faqs.answer: Yes, both SD and DD variants come with full LED lighting including the projector headlamp and DRLs.

name: TVS Apache RTR 160 Race Edition ABS
short_description: TVS Apache RTR 160 Race Edition ABS - A track-inspired variant with dual-tone colors, ABS, and the same 159.7cc engine tuned for spirited riding.

image_urls.alt: TVS Apache RTR 160 Race Edition ABS Front View
TVS Apache RTR 160 Race Edition ABS Side View
TVS Apache RTR 160 Race Edition ABS Back View

pros: Slightly better acceleration than standard variants

faqs.question: Is this the fastest Apache RTR 160 variant?
faqs.answer: Yes, the Race Edition is slightly quicker due to optimized tuning, doing 0-60 kmph in 4.1 seconds.

faqs.question: Does it have dual-channel ABS?
faqs.answer: No, it comes with single-channel ABS (front wheel only).

faqs.question: Are the race graphics durable?
faqs.answer: The decals are quality but may require extra care during washing to prevent peeling over time.

faqs.question: Is the suspension setup different from standard variants?
faqs.answer: It uses the same suspension components but is tuned slightly stiffer for better cornering stability.

name: TVS Apache RTR 160 Race Edition SD
short_description: TVS Apache RTR 160 Race Edition SD - The affordable race-styled variant with semi-digital console, sharing the 159.7cc engine but without ABS.

image_urls.alt: TVS Apache RTR 160 Race Edition SD Front View
TVS Apache RTR 160 Race Edition SD Side View
TVS Apache RTR 160 Race Edition SD Back View

cons: No ABS even as an option

faqs.question: How does this differ from the Race Edition ABS?
faqs.answer: It lacks ABS and has a semi-digital console instead of full digital, but shares the same engine and styling.

faqs.question: Is the suspension setup different?
faqs.answer: No, it uses the same suspension as other variants but may feel stiffer due to lighter weight.

faqs.question: Does it have a gear position indicator?
faqs.answer: Yes, the semi-digital console includes a gear indicator.

faqs.question: Are the race graphics the same as the ABS version?
faqs.answer: Yes, it features identical race-inspired graphics and color schemes as the ABS variant.

name: TVS Apache RTR 4V ABS
short_description: TVS Apache RTR 4V ABS - A 159.7cc street motorcycle with dual-channel ABS, refined 4-valve engine, and sporty ergonomics for spirited riding.

image_urls.alt: TVS Apache RTR 4V ABS Front View
TVS Apache RTR 4V ABS Side View

pros: Refined 4-valve engine with linear power delivery
cons: Pillion seat could be more comfortable

faqs.question: How does the 4V engine differ from standard RTR 160?
faqs.answer: The 4-valve engine breathes better at high RPMs, offering improved top-end performance compared to 2-valve versions.

faqs.question: Is the ABS system switchable?
faqs.answer: No, the dual-channel ABS is always active for safety.

faqs.question: What's the real-world fuel efficiency?
faqs.answer: Expect 38-40 kmpl under normal riding conditions with mixed city-highway usage.

faqs.question: Does it have a slipper clutch?
faqs.answer: No, it comes with a standard wet multi-plate clutch.

name: TVS Jupiter
short_description: TVS Jupiter - A 109.7cc practical commuter scooter with best-in-class comfort features, excellent mileage, and reliable performance for daily commuting.
pros: Comfortable long seat with good cushioning
cons: Drum brake variant lacks stopping power
No charging port in base variant

faqs.question: What's the storage capacity?
faqs.answer: It offers 21 liters of under-seat storage - enough for a full-face helmet and small items.

faqs.question: Is there a disc brake option?
faqs.answer: Yes, a front disc brake variant is available with CBS (Combi Brake System).

faqs.question: How comfortable is it for tall riders?
faqs.answer: The flat floorboard and upright ergonomics make it comfortable for riders up to 6 feet tall.

faqs.question: Does it have a side stand indicator?
faqs.answer: Yes, it comes with a side stand indicator and engine cut-off feature.

name: TVS Max 125
short_description: TVS Max 125 - A 124.53cc commuter motorcycle offering excellent fuel efficiency, low maintenance costs, and reliable performance for daily commuting.
cons: Basic drum brakes lack stopping power

faqs.question: What's the service interval?
faqs.answer: Recommended service interval is every 3,000 km or 3 months, whichever comes first.

faqs.question: Does it have electric start?
faqs.answer: Yes, it comes with both kick and electric start options.

faqs.question: Is it suitable for highway riding?
faqs.answer: While capable, it's best suited for city commuting due to its 90 kmph comfortable cruising speed.

faqs.question: What's the warranty period?
faqs.answer: Standard warranty is 2 years or 30,000 km, whichever comes first.

name: TVS Max 125 ST
short_description: TVS Max 125 ST - A more affordable variant of the Max 125 with similar 124.53cc engine but with cost-saving measures for budget-conscious buyers.
pros: Even better mileage than standard Max 125

faqs.question: What's different from regular Max 125?
faqs.answer: The ST variant has kick start only, smaller fuel tank, and simpler switchgear to reduce costs.

faqs.question: Is the engine same as Max 125?
faqs.answer: Yes, but tuned slightly differently for better mileage at the cost of some power.

faqs.question: Does it have a trip meter?
faqs.answer: No, it comes with a basic analog speedometer without trip meter.

faqs.question: What colors are available?
faqs.answer: Available in basic colors - Black, Red, and Blue with minimal graphics.

name: TVS Metro ELS
short_description: TVS Metro ELS - An economical 99.7cc scooter designed for urban commuting with easy-to-use features, excellent mileage, and low running costs.

faqs.question: What does ELS stand for?
faqs.answer: ELS stands for 'Easy Lift System' - a feature that makes it easier to lift the scooter onto its center stand.

faqs.question: Is it suitable for heavy riders?
faqs.answer: Best suited for riders up to 70kg; performance drops noticeably with heavier loads.

faqs.question: Does it have a charging port?
faqs.answer: No, the base ELS variant doesn't include a charging port.

faqs.question: What's the warranty coverage?
faqs.answer: Comes with 2 years or 30,000 km warranty, whichever comes first.

name: TVS Metro KLS
short_description: TVS Metro KLS - An ultra-affordable 99.7cc commuter scooter with kick-start only, designed for budget-conscious buyers seeking reliable urban transportation.

faqs.question: What does KLS stand for?
faqs.answer: KLS stands for 'Kick Start' version, indicating it doesn't have electric start functionality.

faqs.question: Is it suitable for hilly areas?
faqs.answer: The small engine struggles on steep inclines; better suited for flat urban areas.

faqs.question: Does it have any storage space?
faqs.alt: TVS Metro Plus 110 RE Drum Front View
TVS Metro Plus 110 RE Drum Side View

name: TVS Ntorq 125
short_description: TVS Ntorq 125 - A sporty 124.8cc performance scooter with race-inspired design, liquid-cooled engine, and premium features for young enthusiasts.

faqs.question: Does it have ABS?
faqs.answer: The Race Edition variant comes with ABS, but standard version has CBS (Combi Braking System).

faqs.question: What's special about SmartXonnect?
faqs.answer: It offers Bluetooth connectivity for calls, SMS alerts, navigation assist, and ride analytics.

faqs.question: Is it good for highway riding?
faqs.answer: Can cruise at 80-85 kmph comfortably, but limited by small wheels for extended highway use.

faqs.question: What's the service interval?
faqs.answer: Recommended service every 3,000 km or 3 months due to performance-oriented engine.

name: TVS Radeon
short_description: TVS Radeon - A 109.7cc commuter motorcycle with retro-classic styling, comfortable ergonomics, and fuel-efficient performance for daily commuting.

faqs.question: What's unique about Radeon's design?
faqs.answer: It features retro-classic styling with round headlamp, chrome accents, and vintage-inspired body lines.

faqs.question: Does it have electric start?
faqs.answer: Yes, it comes with both kick and electric start options.

faqs.question: Is it suitable for tall riders?
faqs.answer: Yes, the upright ergonomics and 790mm seat height accommodate tall riders comfortably.

faqs.question: What's the warranty period?
faqs.answer: Standard warranty is 3 years or 40,000 km, whichever comes first.

name: TVS Raider
short_description: TVS Raider - A 124.8cc sporty commuter motorcycle with aggressive styling, segment-first features, and peppy performance for young riders.

faqs.question: Does Raider have any special features?
faqs.answer: Yes, it offers a Glide Through Technology (GTT) for easier low-speed maneuvering in traffic.

faqs.question: Is it suitable for highway riding?
faqs.answer: It can handle short highway stints comfortably at 80-85 kmph, but isn't designed for long highway tours.

faqs.question: What's the service interval?
faqs.answer: Recommended service every 3,000 km or 3 months, whichever comes first.

faqs.question: Does it have a gear position indicator?
faqs.answer: Yes, the digital console includes a gear position indicator.

name: TVS Rockz
short_description: TVS Rockz - A rugged 125cc scooter with muscular styling, long travel suspension, and all-terrain capabilities for adventurous urban commuting.
pros: Long travel suspension for bad roads

faqs.question: Is Rockz suitable for off-road?
faqs.answer: While it has rugged styling, it's primarily designed for rough urban roads rather than true off-roading.

faqs.question: What's the storage capacity?
faqs.answer: It offers 18L under-seat storage plus optional front storage box.

faqs.question: Does it have a charging port?
faqs.answer: Yes, it comes with a 12V charging socket.

faqs.question: Is the suspension adjustable?
faqs.answer: No, it comes with fixed long-travel suspension setup.

name: TVS Stryker
short_description: TVS Stryker - A 125cc commuter motorcycle with bold streetfighter styling, comfortable ergonomics, and reliable performance for daily commuting.

faqs.question: What's unique about Stryker's design?
faqs.answer: It features sharp streetfighter styling with angular bodywork, twin-pod headlight, and muscular fuel tank.

faqs.question: Is it suitable for tall riders?
faqs.answer: Yes, the 800mm seat height and upright ergonomics accommodate tall riders well.

faqs.question: What's the service interval?
faqs.answer: Recommended service every 3,000 km or 3 months, whichever comes first.

faqs.question: Does it have a gear position indicator?
faqs.answer: Yes, the semi-digital console includes a gear position indicator.

name: TVS Wego 110
short_description: TVS Wego 110 - A stylish and practical 110cc scooter with good mileage and comfortable ergonomics for city commuting.

faqs.question: ABS available?
faqs.answer: No, only drum brakes.

faqs.question: Suitable for highways?
faqs.answer: Best for city use; struggles at 80kmph+.

faqs.question: Service cost?
faqs.answer: ~Tk. 700-900 per service.

faqs.question: Weight capacity?
faqs.answer: 140kg (rider + pillion).

name: TVS XL 100
short_description: TVS XL 100 - A rugged and economical 100cc moped known for its durability, high mileage and load-carrying capacity.

faqs.question: Top speed?
faqs.answer: 65kmph (claimed 70kmph).

faqs.question: Service cost?
faqs.answer: Cheapest; ~Tk. 500 per service.

faqs.question: Weight capacity?
faqs.answer: 120kg (rider + cargo).

faqs.question: Highway use?
faqs.answer: Not recommended; best for short city trips.

name: TVS XL 100 Comfort
short_description: TVS XL 100 Comfort - An upgraded version of the XL 100 with improved seating and suspension for better ride comfort.

faqs.question: Difference from standard XL 100?
faqs.answer: Comfort has better seat, suspension, and minor cosmetic upgrades.

faqs.question: Top speed?
faqs.answer: 65kmph (same as standard XL 100).

faqs.question: Weight capacity?
faqs.answer: 120kg (rider + cargo).

faqs.question: Service cost?
faqs.answer: ~Tk. 600 per service.

name: TVS XL 100 ES
short_description: TVS XL 100 ES - The most basic and affordable variant of the XL 100 series, offering bare-bones functionality with unmatched fuel efficiency.

faqs.question: Difference from standard XL 100?
faqs.answer: ES is lighter, has fewer features, and is cheaper.

faqs.question: Top speed?
faqs.answer: 65kmph (same as other XL 100 variants).

faqs.question: Service cost?
faqs.answer: As low as Tk. 400 per service.

faqs.question: Weight capacity?
faqs.answer: 115kg (rider + cargo).

name: TVS RTR 310
short_description: TVS RTR 310 - A high-performance 310cc supersport motorcycle with track-focused dynamics, premium components, and aggressive styling.
cons: Limited service network for premium bikes
Small fuel tank for a sportbike

faqs.question: ABS available?
faqs.answer: Yes, dual-channel ABS with Supermoto mode.

faqs.question: Suitable for beginners?
faqs.answer: Not recommended; very powerful for new riders.

faqs.question: Service cost?
faqs.answer: ~Tk. 5,000-7,000 per service.

faqs.question: Weight capacity?
faqs.answer: 180kg (rider + pillion).

name: TVS 300 RR
short_description: TVS 300 RR - A race-spec version of the RTR 310 with track-focused upgrades including lighter weight, more power, and racing components.

faqs.question: ABS available?
faqs.answer: No, removed for racing purposes.

faqs.question: Street legal?
faqs.answer: Limited road legality; primarily for track use.

faqs.question: Service cost?
faqs.answer: ~Tk. 8,000-10,000 per service.

faqs.question: Weight capacity?
faqs.answer: 170kg (rider only; not designed for pillion).
